attributes.action: If the Government wants us to set an example and demonstrate the way to Net Zero
attributes.additional_details:
The UK governments say they wish the UK to set an example to the world by achieving Net Zero. To do this, politicians need to show that they are all committed to it by following the actions that are being proposed in the Carbon Budget.
If they expect the public to make the proposed changes at their own expense, then they also must do likewise.
The Houses of Parliament and Whitehall should show of how Net Zero can be achieved with heat pumps instead of using gas, and car chargers in the garages.
attributes.background:
All members of:
 The Climate Change Committee
 The House of Commons
 The House of Lords
 Senior Members of the Civil Service
Must at their own expense:
 Have their houses insulated to a minimum EPC B standard
 Replace gas with Heat Pumps and Electric Cookers
 Drive only Electric Vehicles

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. 
 
Decisions about residential heating are a matter for the private individuals, not the UK Government or Parliament.
